meanings.definition: A Hebrew unit of dry measure equal to about a bushel.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, farmers would use an epha to measure their grain harvest.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor sold a whole epha of apples to the customer.
meanings.sent3: The epha decided to take a break and rest on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The epha of knowledge she gained from reading was overflowing.
meanings.sent5: The epha was as big as a large basket, holding plenty of wheat.

meanings.definition: A Hebrew unit of liquid measure equal to about a gallon.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for an epha of olive oil to be added to the mixture.
meanings.sent2: She poured an epha of water into the container to fill it up.
meanings.sent3: The epha of juice spilled all over the table, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like an epha of pure honey, sweet and overflowing.
meanings.sent5: The epha of milk was carefully measured out for the recipe, ensuring the perfect consistency.
